review_blob:
Good flavor and repeatable.  Hoppy enough, but blended well into a real drinkable beer.  Since you have to buy the case in PA, I got pretty used to this brew, in the old Miller Highl Life tradition.   
Now, if you want to treat yourself to the PA black and tan, mix this with the Yuengling porter, grill some homme made sausage and you are pretty darn close to heaven.

This is good beer, tamed from the disctint sharpness of Premium, and the amber color, flavoring adds a distinct taste that is repeatable, but does not linger too long or wear thin. If youve had the "mother" brew, Yuengling Premium, try this with a fresh perspective,  Most worldly brew coming form Pottsville.
Very very nice pale ale. A standard Clean, crisp, hoppy.  Most drinkable, and make sure you have plenty on hand.

Had recently in can packaging.  It was very good with a distinctive palate, and nice flavor, smooth and doesnt wear thin.  A distinct palate that must be fresh to be appreciated, it goes stale and ruins the beer.  Also great with food, sushi.  I used to be a Tsingtao fan, but Sapporo has a fuller flavor.

Great beer, if you like a amber lager, this is it, slightly hoppy but so nicely balanced iwth the carmel, honey and flavor of a "bock".  Great for a few beers, then wears a bit thin, but hey what doesnt...P.S. the old original bock, was a real bock, even better than this.  long gone

Sorry, I like it.  I liked it the first time I drank it in the 70s, For me no headache, like bud will leave (substitute the rice for grain and you get Busch).  Very drinkable, everyday beer, not too heavy and great on a hot southern weekend....with or without NASCAR.
Oh yeah, cant beat the price.

Just tried the "new" old Schaefer.  Ive experienced this beer over its transient history rooted in the real brooklyn brew (albeit the one in the 70s).  This latest version is not bad, not as hoppy and sharp as the Strohs days, but less distinct as the NY days.  Drinkable, light kind of bland, and still cheap.  Ive tasted much, much worse.
